summary.p: The bundle (35-3154 palm leaf manuscript) is in Telugu script. It contains Śrībhāṣya (incomplete) up to the second chapter. Śrīmadrāmānujācārya, who lived in 11th century, has contributed nine works in Sanskrit on the Viśiṣṭādvaita philosophy school. One among those is Śrībhāṣya. The Śrībhāṣya is the elaborate commentary on the Brahmasūtrā-s. Bādarāyaṇa (Vedavyāsa) is the author of Brahmasūtrā-s. The Brahmasūtrā-s consist of four adhyāyā-s (chapters) and each of four chapters consists of four pādā-s (parts). The first chapter is called the Samanvayādhyāya. The second chapter is called Avirodhādhyāya. The third chapter is called Sādhanādhyāya. The last chapter is called Phalādhyāya.

Rāmānuja presents the fundamental philosophical principles of viśiṣṭādvaita based on his interpretation of the Upaniṣad-s, Bhagavadgītā and other smṛti texts. In his Śrībhasya he describes the three categories of reality (tattvā-s): cit (soul), acit (jaḍa or matter), and cidaciviśiṣṭa (God). The principles of bhakti as a means to liberation (mokṣa) were also developed. Rāmānuja wrote the Vedāntadīpa and Vedāntasāra to aid in the overall understanding of the Śrībhāṣya.

msItem.incipit: akhilabhuvanajanmasthemabhaṅgādilīle vinatavividhabhūtavrātarakṣaikadīkṣe | śrutiśirasi vidīpte brahmaṇi śrīnivāse bhavatu mama parasmin śemuṣī bhaktirūpā || pārāśaryavacaḥ sudhām upaniṣaddugdhābdhimadhyoddhṛtāṃ | saṃsārāgnividīpanavyapagataprāṇātm asaṃjīvanīm | pūrvācāryasurakṣitāṃ bahumativyāghātadūrasthitām ānītāṃ | tu nijākṣaraiḥ sumanaso bhaumāḥ pibantvanvaham || bhagavadbodhāyanakṛtāṃ vistīrṇāṃ brahmasūtravṛttiṃ pūrvācāryāḥ saṃcikṣipuḥ tanmatānusāreṇa sūtrākṣarāṇi vyākhyāsyante — athāto brahmajijñāsā |
msItem.explicit: vaiśeṣyāt tu tadvādas tadvādaḥ | vaiśeṣyaṃ – viśeṣabhāvaḥ, trivṛtkāraṇena nirūpe 'py ekasminn annādyādhikyāt tatra tatrānnādivādaḥ | dviruktiḥ adhyāyaparisamāptiṃ dyotayati |
